basics.name: Varun Ullanat
basics.label: Biomedical AI Researcher and Prospective PhD Student
basics.summary: Biomedical AI researcher specializing in protein language models, computational pathology, and AI-driven healthcare solutions.

work.name: Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
work.summary: Led enhancements in PathML and implemented AI pipelines for EHR analysis.
highlights: Improved PathML software with 20,000 lines of code.
Achieved 90% accuracy in extracting cancer-related data.

projects.name: AI-Powered Chatbot for Policy Navigation
projects.description: Developed Dana-Farber's first chatbot to allow staff to navigate institutional policy documents interactively.
highlights: Enabled access to 13,000 providers and staff.

projects.name: Protein Language Model for PPI Prediction
projects.description: Designed and implemented a novel protein language model (PLM) for protein-protein interaction predictions.
highlights: Achieved 10% improvement in PPI prediction tasks.
Conducted two case studies on cancer mutation effects and SARS-CoV-2 antibodies.

projects.name: Multimodal Drug-Drug Interaction Prediction
projects.description: Developed encoders and novel techniques for textual inputs in drug-drug interaction prediction.
highlights: Achieved a zero-shot AUPRC of over 0.60.

projects.name: Live Cell Microscopy Image Classification and Generation
projects.description: Developed a CNN for cell type classification and a DDPM for generating synthetic microscopy images.
highlights: Enhanced automated microscopy workflows with synthetic data.
Identified key differentiating features between cell types through explainability analysis.

projects.name: Cultural Insights from Restaurant Reviews using LLMs
projects.description: Fine-tuned a pretrained LLM for multi-document summarization tasks using restaurant reviews.
highlights: Built an interactive application using React and FastAPI.
Evaluated model performance using common NLP metrics.

projects.name: Transcriptomic Analysis of Alzheimer’s Patients
projects.description: Analyzed microarray data to compare symptomatic and asymptomatic Alzheimer’s patients.
highlights: Used gene expression techniques like DGE and ORA.
Generated insights on brain region-specific transcriptomic differences.

projects.name: Precision for Integrative Structural Models (PrISM)
projects.description: Developed a Python-based integrative protein structure analysis package.

projects.name: Regulatory Network Analysis in Cancer
projects.description: Performed computational analysis of regulatory networks implicated in epithelial-mesenchymal plasticity of cancer.
highlights: Contributed to the theory of regulatory node 'teams' constraining cancer phenotypic outcomes.
